alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Campbell; Claiborne; Grainger; Hancock; Morgan; Scott; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 2:12PM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following areas, Anderson, Bledsoe, Blount Smoky Mountains, Bradley, Campbell, Claiborne, East Polk, Grainger, Hamilton, Hancock, Knox, Loudon, Marion, McMinn, Meigs, Morgan, Northwest Blount, Northwest Monroe, Rhea, Roane, Scott TN, Sequatchie, Southeast Monroe, Union and West Polk. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following areas, Lee and Wise. * WHEN...From 7 PM EST /6 PM CST/ this evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain and isolated embedded thunderstorms will move across the region tonight with locally heavy rainfall expected. One to three inches of rain are expected, with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
